001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.fitting;
002
003import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.ArrayRealVector;
004import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
005import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
008import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
009
010import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
011
012public class AffineFit2D implements LinearFit2D {
013        
014        private final RealMatrix A;             // the calculated transformation matrix
015        private final double err;               // the calculated error
016        
017        /**
018         * Constructor.
019         * Fits two sequences of 2D points using an affine transformation model.
020         * At least 3 point pairs are required. For 3 point pairs, the solution
021         * is an exact fit, otherwise a least-squares fit is found.
022         * @param P the source points
023         * @param Q the target points
024         */
025        public AffineFit2D(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {      // 
026                checkSize(P, Q);
027                int m = P.length;
028                
029                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2 * m, 6);
030                RealVector b = new ArrayRealVector(2 * m);
031                
032                // mount the matrix M
033                int row = 0;
034                for (Pnt2d p : P) {
035                        M.setEntry(row, 0, p.getX());
036                        M.setEntry(row, 1, p.getY());
037                        M.setEntry(row, 2, 1);
038                        row++;
039                        M.setEntry(row, 3, p.getX());
040                        M.setEntry(row, 4, p.getY());
041                        M.setEntry(row, 5, 1);
042                        row++;
043                }
044                
045                // mount vector b
046                row = 0;
047                for (Pnt2d q : Q) {
048                        b.setEntry(row, q.getX());
049                        row++;
050                        b.setEntry(row, q.getY());
051                        row++;
052                }
053                
054                // solve M * a = b (for the unknown parameter vector a):
055                DecompositionSolver solver = new SingularValueDecomposition(M).getSolver();
056                RealVector a = solver.solve(b);
057                A = makeTransformationMatrix(a);
058                err = calculateError(P, Q, A);
059        }
060
061        // creates a (2 x 3) transformation matrix from the elements of a
062        private RealMatrix makeTransformationMatrix(RealVector a) {
063                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(2, 3);
064                int i = 0;
065                for (int row = 0; row < 2; row++) {
066                        // get (n+1) elements from a and place in row
067                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
068                                A.setEntry(row, j, a.getEntry(i));
069                                i++;
070                        }
071                }
072                return A;
073        }
074        
075        // --------------------------------------------------------
076        
077        private void checkSize(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
078                if (P.length < 3 || Q.length < 3) {
079                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least 3 point pairs are required to calculate this fit");
080                }
081        }
082        
083        // --------------------------------------------------------
084
085        @Override
086        public double[][] getTransformationMatrix() {
087                return A.getData();
088//              return A;
089        }
090
091        @Override
092        public double getError() {
093                return err;
094        }
095
096}
